Description.val:
Commercial Cargo Vehicles - The Commercial Cargo Vehicles program is a centrally managed PMC program for procurement of commercially-available and general purpose vehicles such as heavy and light trucks, special purpose trucks, certain fire department trucks, refuse collection trucks, tanker trucks and all types of trailers.

Emergency Response Vehicles (ERV) - Funds in this line are used for the replacement of firefighting apparatuses for maintaining the minimal installations ERV requirements for structural and airfield operations capabilities throughout the Marine Corps.

P-19 Replacement - The Aircraft Rescue & Fire Fighting (ARFF) vehicle will be equipped with fire suppression compounds and extinguishing agents, handheld extinguishers, and specialized rescue tools used by firefighters to extinguish aircraft and structural fires. The P-19R is a materiel solution that provides functional capability to minimize the consequences of an aircraft crash.  Funding in this line provides for vehicle procurement and support.

Justification.val:
The FY 2016 funding request was reduced by $0.295M to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

FY14 Base Appropriation: $31.921M
Commercial Cargo Vehicles - $11.723M FY14 funding increase from $10.542M to $11.723M is a result of current year deficiencies (CYDs) funds to support mission critical Cargo equipment.  Funds were procured for a portfolio of MCIPAC ($3.918M), MCIWEST ($3.986M), MCIEAST ($2.320M) and other Commands ($1.499M) non-tactical general purpose vehicles inclusive of heavy duty and light trucks, special purpose trucks, refuse collection trucks, certain fire department trucks, tanker trucks and all types of trailers to support the deployment and resetting of Operating Forces.  Funds used to replace non-operational and over-aged general purpose vehicles and equipment to comply with the California Air Resource Board (CARB) mandates required to support the Operating Forces training, readiness, deployment and reconstitution. 
  
Emergency Response Vehicles $3.427M - Funds were used to procure (3) Wildland Pumpers ($0.950M) and (4) Fire pumpers ($1.550M) and (1) Hazmat Truck ($0.435M), (3) Ambulance ($0.492M) for Marine Corps activities and commands.

P-19R - $16.771M initiated procurement of Low Rate Initial Procurements (LRIP) quantities of the P-19R, Initial Issue Provisions (IIPs), program support and allowed for the transitioning of the P-19A legacy system that is beyond rebuild and is no longer sustainable. 

FY15 Base Appropriation: $11.035M
P-19R - $11.035M will procure additional LRIP quantities as well as provide for other programmatic support costs in support of the Full Rate Production (FRP) Decision for the P-19 replacement vehicles.

FY16 Base Appropriation Request: $22.806M 
Commercial Cargo Vehicles - $0.891M - Funds will procure a portfolio ($0.891M) of non-tactical general purpose vehicles such as heavy duty and light trucks, special purpose trucks, refuse collection trucks, certain fire department trucks, tanker trucks and all types of trailers to support the deployment and resetting of Operating Forces.  Equipment acquired will comply with the California Air Resource Board (CARB) mandates required to support the Operating Forces training, readiness, deployment and reconstitution. 

Emergency Response Vehicles - $2.969M - Funds will procure ladder trucks and fire pumpers for Marine Corps activities and commands.

P-19R - $18.946M will continue to procure FRP quantities as well as provide for other programmatic support costs in support of the Full Rate Production (FRP) decision. The increase ($11.771M) in funding from FY15 to FY16 is due to the increase in quantities for FRP.

Name.@footnote: The unit cost increase is attributed to the Firm Fixed Price contract with stepladder pricing.

ProcQuantity.@footnote: Rampdown from first month delivery will be due to first delivery being a bay build with next 3 months being production line builds.
